review: The Roku 3500R worked exactly as expected. It was very easy to connect to an HDMI port and to a power outlet, and once initialized it allowed us to access all of the usual download sites. We expect to use it on two TVs that are not connected to a Time Warner cable box, and our experience shows that it works fine for accessing Amazon Prime and other sites.

review: My problem with the Stick was owning two Roku 3's first.  The stick is slower and requires a stronger WiFi signal.  It also requires a power cord that, if you are lucky, can plug into your sets USB port.  My port wasn't powerful enough to operate the stick satisfactory (pauses, lost WiFi signal) so I had to use the included power converter.  I also had to use a Hdmi right angle adaptor so the stick would not lie against the back to the set and overheat.  If you have a strong WiFi signal, don"t need a gaming remote, and like the lower cost then you'll be happy with the stick.  Otherwise spend the extra money, get a RoKu 3 and Velcro tape and mount the 3 on the back to the set.
